knimeNode.name: Custom R View
knimeNode.shortDescription: Visualize available models and/or data related to one particular experiment.

fullDescription.intro: This node uses R code to plot a graph of data and / or models which are related to a single experiment. It can be used to inspect a set of models and find the model fitting best to the measured data. If you do not specify measured values (i.e. a table "Versuchsbedingungen" in the input table array), you will have to provide a minimum and maximum limit for the t-axis in the plot in the options dialog. You can enter integers or decimal values, where the decimal sign is a comma (',').
fullDescription.option: Define the minimum value of the x-axis, if no data is provided.
Define the maximum value of the x-axis, if no data is provided.

ports.inPort: Array of data tables from the node Load Related Data".

views.view: The view window shows the generated plots. Each experiment will result in a graphic plot. You can switch between the plots for the different test conditions (“Versuchsbedingungen”) by clicking on the arrows next to the plot number indicator on the right hand side or by using the keyboard (UP and DOWN).
